intro: Gomphrena meyeniana var. genuina, commonly known as the red or pink plume flower, is a herbaceous perennial native to South America. It is characterized by its feathery, plume-like inflorescences that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. Its foliage is lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It is often cultivated for its long-lasting blooms and ability to attract pollinators.
